newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech seeks aid six days after shot through head.
newsitem.headline: Czech seeks aid six days after shot through head.

text.p: Czech police are astonished by the case of a man who was shot through the head but only sought medical treatment six days later, CTK news agency said on Monday.
The 48-year-old from the eastern city of Liberec was shot in his apartment by an entrepreneur on January 18 in what police described as "careless use of a weapon".
The bullet from a handgun entered his left nostril and passed through his head before leaving by a temple, the Czech agency quoted doctors as saying.
The man sought medical help only last Friday and has spent three days in intensive care in a Liberec hospital.
"It is an extraordinary curiosity that the shot man was fully conscious and fully capable of communicating with us," a Liberec police spokesman said.
The wounded man will probably need up to seven weeks to recover. Police have charged the businessman with a grievous threat to health, CTK said.
